snippet: Google said it would not comply with a White House request to reconsider the anti-Islam video that has set off violent protests, saying it did not violate its terms of service regarding hate speech.
abstract: Google, which owns YouTube, says it will not comply with White House request to reconsider the anti-Islam video that has set off violent protests in the Arab world, saying video does not violate the company's terms of service regarding hate speech.
lead_paragraph: Google said it would not comply with a White House request to reconsider the anti-Islam video that has set off violent protests, saying it did not violate its terms of service regarding hate speech.

headline.seo: Google Won’t Rethink Anti-Islam Video’s Status
headline.main: Google Has No Plans to Rethink Video Status
headline.print_headline: Google Has No Plans To Rethink Video Status
